Sequence Information.Source: Synthetic construct(derived from HIV-1 gene products(Vpr))
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.20586421]HIV-1:Inhibition of 3′-end processing catalyzed by integrase(IC50=0.005±0.002 µM);inhibition of strand transfer catalyzed by integrase(IC50=0.006±0.006 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Mechanism of action: IN is an essential enzyme for the stable infection of host cells because it catalyzes the insertion of viral DNA inside the pre-integration complex (PIC) into the genome of host cells in two successive reactions, designated as strand transfer and 3′-end-processing. The peptide could inhibit the activity of integrase and thus inhibit virus replication.

Literature.Title: Peptide HIV-1 integrase inhibitors from HIV-1 gene products.
Literature.Author: Suzuki S, Urano E, Hashimoto C, Tsutsumi H, Nakahara T, Tanaka T, Nakanishi Y, Maddali K, Han Y, Hamatake M, Miyauchi K, Pommier Y, Beutler JA, Sugiura W, Fuji H, Hoshino T, Itotani K, Nomura W, Narumi T, Yamamoto N, Komano JA, Tamamura H.

Literature.Title: Peptidic HIV integrase inhibitors derived from HIV gene products: structure-activity relationship studies
Literature.Author: Suzuki S, Maddali K, Hashimoto C, Urano E, Ohashi n, Tanaka T, Ozaki T, Arai H, Tsutsumi H, narumi T
